text: Yasmā ca kho bhikkhave vedanā anattā tasmā vedanā ābādhāya saṃvattati na ca labbhati vedanāya evaṃ me vedanā hotu evaṃ me vedanā mā ahosī ti
edit: Yasmā ca kho bhikkhave vedanā anattā tasmā vedanā ābādhāya saṃvattati na ca labbhati vedanāya – evaṃ me vedanā hotu evaṃ me vedanā mā ahosī ti

translations.transtext: Because, monks, feeling [is] nonself, therefore feeling exists for illness, and [one] does not obtain the feeling thus, "May my feeling be in this way, may my feeling not have been in this way."
